title: What is the experience of being hypnotized like, and what are the different sensations that come with it?
first_phrase: In this last part of the text, the author describes the effects of being under the influence of Mr. Donato's hypnotic abilities. The author, initially a skeptic, was suddenly grabbed by the power of the hypnotist's gaze, which led him to fall into a state similar to catalepsy. The author claims that he did not experience any external sensations during this state. This text sheds light on the concept of hypnotism and the power of a hypnotist over a person's will.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the author's initial skepticism of mesmerism and hypnosis compelled him to explore these phenomena personally. The result of this venture led him to experience the mysterious and inexplicable realm of scientific wonders, including the cataleptic state induced by the powerful gaze of the mesmerizer. This experience offers a unique perspective and insight into the vastly different sensations felt by the subject, including a state of complete amnesia that lends a mystical quality to the practice of mesmerism.
